metadata.title: CVE-2019-14295 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An Integer overflow in the getElfSections function in p_vmlinx.cpp in UPX 3.95 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a skewed offset larger than the size of the PE section in a UPX packed executable, which triggers an allocation of excessive memory.

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.95-2').
